abstract_summ: Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) 2, is an essential receptor for cell fusion and engulfs the SARS coronavirus infections . ACE2 downregulation by SARS-CoV-2 spike protein leads to an overactivation of Angiotenin (Ang) II/AT1R axis and the deleterious effects of Ang II may explain the multiorgan dysfunction seen in patients . Brain tissue injury increases ACE2 levels in the lungs after experimental stroke .
